title: Software Engineer
description:
What You'll Do

The selected candidate will be part of a team that builds and supports custom, enterprise-wide, Web-based applications for our clients. In this position, the candidate will experience the full lifecycle of application development in an energetic and professional team environment.


Responsibilites

The primary function of this position is to design, build, deploy, and support enterprise-wide, Web-based applications for our global clients by performing the following duties:

  • Design, code, and implement new systems using a variety of technologies.

  • Implement bug fixes and enhancements on existing systems.

  • Ensure system quality by performing unit and full system testing.

  • Provide user support as needed.

  • Document system requirements as needed.


What You'll Need

To succeed in this challenging role, candidates should possess the following characteristics:

  • Minimum 2 years development experience utilizing Java/J2EE or C#/.NET

  • Experience with one or more RDBMS (Oracle, SQL Server, PostgreSQL)

  • Experience with client-side technologies: HTML/XHTML, CSS, JavaScript, AJAX

  • Experience or exposure to any of the following is a plus: .NET, Apache Tomcat, Hibernate, Struts, Spring, Velocity, Crystal Reports, SQL Server Reporting Services, Linux, Liferay, Microsoft SharePoint

  • Ability to work as part of a small team

  • Ability to support existing systems and interact with end users

  • Ability to quickly learn and implement new technologies

  • Strong work ethic and ability to meet strict deadlines

  • Strong verbal and written communications skills


Who You Are

  • Driven learner who loves researching new technologies

  • Well educated and experienced technologist who can function throughout the entire technical stack

  • Business minded professional who understands how to transform business needs into technical solutions

  • Collaborative Engineer who is able to work independently or as part of a small team

  • Strong verbal and written communicator with the ability to interface directly with clients


How to reach us:

Email your resume to inquiries@echelon.org


We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.

title: Software Engineer
description:
Novus is an innovative company that is changing the way the world invests. We are a high growth, disruptive technology firm bringing big data analytics to the alternative investment industry. Our platform enables investors to consistently maximize their performance potential through discovery of true investment acumen and risk, proprietary industry insights and expertise, and effortless data management and enlightenment.

Software is a foundational component of our business and we only hire the best. We are seeking energetic developers with an eye for scalable, elegant code and a passion for continuous learning.

Background

We operate in an industry in which over $120 Trillion is invested annually on behalf pension / endowment / sovereign funds, and private investors / family offices. And yet, the lack of data intelligence and insight results in much of that money being invested based purely on historic track record, with little transparency into performance acumen and / or risk management. This is our challenge and our purpose: to help investors make better investments. And in doing so, we aim to provide the single network on which trusted professionals will engage, promote, and manage their business. In short, we want to help the world invest better. And we need you.

Role

You will report to one of our VPs of Engineering, and be based in Austin.

You will play a pivotal role in one of our many small development teams. You will work within a modern technology stack, autonomously and collaboratively, to make tangible impact for our clients.

Responsibilities will include:
  • Transforming product vision into composable and scalable architecture
  • Implementing complex systems, in short iterations, that delight our customers.
  • Developing deep expertise in portfolio analysis and the alternative investment industry
  • Enhancing and re-imaginning core infrastructure components to increase stability and speed
  • Growing your software development skills using Functional and Object Oriented principles
We're looking for people who are smart, humble, and care deeply about our mission.

Culture

Our culture is critical to us. Its how we push ourselves every day to do better than the day before. We expect our team members to deliver on their responsibilities, understand how each and every component of our company works to generate success, and hold themselves and their colleagues accountable to the highest standards.

As a result, we will enjoy talking to you if:
  • You are challenged and fulfilled by interesting and difficult problems and expect the same from colleagues.
  • When uncomfortable with the status quo you push to drive change.
  • You have a thirst for learning; strong history of skill improvement and learning new technologies.
  • You love to build things in your free time and contribute to the open source community.
  • You are smart, ambitious, supportive, and inspire others to fulfill their potential.
Critical Skills/Abilities
  • You can own challenging problems from inception to production.
  • You write correct, robust, performant, scalable and readable code.
  • You approach problems with a logical mindset and deliver systematic solutions.
  • You articulate complexity in linear, digestible, audience-appropriate language.
  • 2+ years post graduate experience working in small, high growth dev teams.
  • A mature interest in finance coupled with an understanding of portfolio theory and market dynamics.

title: Software Engineer
description:
This is a full stack software engineering position responsible for developing new and existing frontend and backend cloud software to be utilized with CTS kiosks across multiple clients.

Education/Experience Requirements:
  • Bachelor’s degree or equivalent in MIS, Computer Science or related field
  • Minimum 3 years of experience in web and software development
Software Engineer Job Responsibilities:
  • Creating software requirement specifications
  • Software and relational database design
  • Software development, testing, and implementation
  • Ongoing support and maintenance of implemented software
  • Assisting in the support and maintenance of our network infrastructure
Skills and Competencies Requirements:

Demonstrated knowledge of various technologies, such as:
  • Angular (4.0)
  • Java o CSS, SASS, LESS Spring Framework: Boot, Data, MVC
  • Relational Database knowledge, SQL and ORM (JPA, Hibernate)
  • AWS Cloud Experience o Unix
Essential Competencies:
  • Strong Communication
  • Analytical/Detail Oriented
  • Assertiveness
  • Decision Making
  • Customer Focus
  • Positivity
  • Collaborative
Position includes excellent benefits package such as:
  • Medical-vision/dental and life insurance plans
  • 401(k) plan
  • Paid Holidays
  • Personal Paid Time Off

title: Software Engineer
description:
Software Engineer - Verathon®

Verathon has an exciting opportunity in our New Product Development group for a Software Engineer. This position will be responsible for systems software and applications development in support of our latest medical devices and products.

This Software Engineer is expected to work with the team to provide technical acumen and apply development skills to a variety of technologies. This position encompasses both research and prototyping for potential new products, and medical product development using a formal quality system.

Principal Responsibilities
  • Participate in research and development of prototypes for a variety of new medical products, including use of cloud-based micro services and deep learning algorithms.
  • Participate in formal product requirements definition, detailed design, coding, testing and integration.
  • Develop firmware and unit tests for embedded Linux and bare metal systems, primarily using C/C++.
  • Deliver robust software releases for medical device manufacturing under a formal quality system (IEC-62304), and as needed support those releases in manufacturing.
  • Requires close interaction and participation with a multidisciplinary team including software, hardware, signal processing, and test engineers.
Knowledge, Skills, and Abilities
  • BSCS, BSEE, or equivalent technical degree or substantial work experience required.
  • 5+ years’ experience developing embedded software; experience with medical or avionic development processes is a plus, as is experience with developing micro services or cloud-based services.
  • Experience developing firmware for ARM Cortex-Mx or other 32-bit MCU (bare metal, device drivers, and state machines) using IDEs such as IAR, Keil, Atollic, etc. Experience with lab equipment such as oscilloscopes, logic analyzers, and JTAG is required.
  • Experience with developing/debugging Linux kernel drivers and user-level drivers is a plus.
  • Experience with object-oriented analysis, design and development in a team environment is a plus.
  • Experience providing accurate estimates and meeting your scheduled commitments.
  • Experience making independent judgments using sound engineering principles and techniques.
  • Good software development process skills including source code configuration management (Git).
  • Good software documentation skills.
About Verathon:

Verathon is a wholly owned subsidiary of Roper Industries, an acquisitive S&P 500 and NYSE listed diversified growth company. Verathon is headquartered in the greater Seattle area, in Bothell, Washington, and has 7 international subsidiaries in Canada, Europe and Asia. The company designs, manufactures, distributes and markets reliable, state-of-the-art medical devices and services to the health care community that offer meaningful improvement in patient care. Our largest brands, BladderScan and GlideScope, have achieved worldwide recognition as the number one leader in their respective markets. Verathon is a financially sound company with consistent growth and performance even during down market cycles. We have a strong pipeline of new products for multiple areas of discipline within the health care industry.

Verathon was acquired by Roper Industries (US Ticker symbol ROP) in December 2009 as a platform for future acquisitions leveraging the talented management team and extraordinary channel development in developed country markets.

Verathon offers competitive compensation and a complete benefits package to full-time employees including company sponsored health plan, 401k with match, wellness and tuition reimbursement and the advantages of an environment that supports your development and recognizes your achievements.

Verathon is an equal opportunity employer and strongly supports diversity in the workplace. We believe that diverse ideas, opinions and perspectives will build a strong foundation for success.

title: Software Engineer
description:
If your first thought when encountered by any daily inefficiency is “I could write a program that is better than this….” then this job is for you! (It’s ok if you never actually get around to writing that program. We get it.)

WHAT YOU’LL DO:

  • Design, develop, test, and maintain production-level enterprise applications deployed to cloud infrastructure
  • Extend open-source libraries and systems as necessary to meet the needs of the team
  • Design and implement functionality that spans from storage to middleware to browser
  • Create interactive Web-based user interface components and data visualizations
  • Work closely with customers and teammates to rapidly build, test, and deploy new capabilities

TASKS YOU MIGHT WORK ON:

  • Investigate ways to model historical event behavior to provide baselines for comparison when visualizing current event activity
  • Stand up an instance of Zeppelin for an Apache Spark cluster on AWS and write a Spark analytic that summarizes event data stored in AWS S3 and writes the results to Elasticsearch
  • Build and maintain a streaming ETL infrastructure capable of reliably processing thousands of events a second and writing them to a clustered Kafka topic

WHY WE SHOULD TALK:

  • You love technology (eg. MEAN, LAMP, ELK, Spark, Storm, Cassandra, Hadoop, AWS, and more)
  • You’ve got a solid foundation in development, and aren’t tied to one language or framework—we’re using Java, JavaScript, C++, PHP, Python, HTML, CSS, AngularJS and Spring (among others)
  • You’re tired of refactoring someone else’s code built on ancient technology
  • You want to work in a lively yet laid-back environment full of people who love learning (and craft beer/fine coffee)
  • You’re tired of being bored at work; and you remember when coding used to be fun
  • You want to build stuff people actually use
  • Because tabs > spaces. Because spaces>tabs. ugh, nevermind… O_o
  • You’re a U.S. Citizen and want to obtain a high-level security clearance

TL;DR

Do you love to code? Doesn’t matter if it’s the front-end, back-end, storage, analytics. You love it all? You’re in the right place—so do we!

WHAT YOU’LL DO:

  • Design, develop, test, and maintain production-level enterprise applications deployed to cloud infrastructure
  • Extend open-source libraries and systems as necessary to meet the needs of the team
  • Design and implement functionality that spans from storage to middleware to browser
  • Create interactive Web-based user interface components and data visualizations
  • Work closely with customers and teammates to rapidly build, test, and deploy new capabilities

TASKS YOU MIGHT WORK ON:

  • Investigate ways to model historical event behavior to provide baselines for comparison when visualizing current event activity
  • Stand up an instance of Zeppelin for an Apache Spark cluster on AWS and write a Spark analytic that summarizes event data stored in AWS S3 and writes the results to Elasticsearch
  • Build and maintain a streaming ETL infrastructure capable of reliably processing thousands of events a second and writing them to a clustered Kafka topic

WHY WE SHOULD TALK:

  • You love technology (eg. MEAN, LAMP, ELK, Spark, Storm, Cassandra, Hadoop, AWS, and more)
  • You’ve got a solid foundation in development, and aren’t tied to one language or framework—we’re using Java, JavaScript, C++, PHP, Python, HTML, CSS, AngularJS and Spring (among others)
  • You’re tired of refactoring someone else’s code built on ancient technology
  • You want to work in a lively yet laid-back environment full of people who love learning (and craft beer/fine coffee)
  • You’re tired of being bored at work; and you remember when coding used to be fun
  • You want to build stuff people actually use
  • Because tabs > spaces. Because spaces>tabs. ugh, nevermind… O_o
  • You’re a U.S. Citizen and want to obtain a high-level security clearance

TL;DR

Do you love to code? Doesn’t matter if it’s the front-end, back-end, storage, analytics. You love it all? You’re in the right place—so do we!

title: Software Engineer
description:
Development of Wi-Fi test automation software, support of program development and self-certification business by providing and delivering high-value solutions. He/she will work with the best technical and marketing talent within Wi-Fi Alliance member companies, driving industry-visible efforts that support the mission of establishing Wi-Fi technology as the center of seamless connectivity.

Wi-Fi Alliance is seeking a Software Engineer to develop and support Wi-Fi test automation software, support program development and self-certification business by providing and delivering high-value solutions. Reports to Director, Software Engineering.

Duties

· Development of Wi-Fi Alliance test automation software

· Develop new Wi-Fi Alliance program with teams and members

· Solve technical problem across multiple teams

· Stay abreast of emerging technologies and trends and communicate to the business

· Embrace the innovative culture and actively participate in innovation

· Recommend development best practices

Experience/Skills

· Experienced in Wi-Fi, software and test automation development

· Excellent analytic and problem-solving skills with proficiency in diagnosing and troubleshooting complex software system that runs on multiple platforms including Linux and Windows

· Solid experience in design and development of network, multi-threaded, database, embedded, and distributed applications

· Strong and effective inter-personal and communication skills and the ability to interact professionally with a diverse group of clients

· Strong object-oriented analysis and design experience and familiar with design patterns and various software architectures

· Experienced in C, C++, Python, Perl

· BS in CS or EE or science field with 3 years of experience or equivalent

· Self-motivated with minimal supervision

· Familiar with Wi-Fi certification and process will be a plus

Education

· BS in Computer Science or Electrical Engineering or science field with 3 or more years of experience

Salary, Benefits, Etc.

· Compensation commensurate with education and experience

· Competitive benefits, including health, dental, vision, 401K

· Position located in Santa Clara, CA—no relocation


Position located in Santa Clara, CA—no relocation, local candidates only

Interested candidates should send your resume to jobs@wi-fi.org.

Wi-Fi Alliance participates in E-Verify. For more information, please refer to www.dhs.gov/E-Verify


Company Description

Wi-Fi Alliance is a rapidly-growing global trade organization that prizes collaboration. We work with cutting edge technology in a dynamic and inspiring work culture that supports a strong work/life balance, new opportunities, and individual growth. Regardless of discipline, all who work here contribute to delivering the terrific user experience for which Wi-Fi is known.

Our work is challenging but rewarding, and we take time to celebrate our success. The environment is supportive, providing opportunities for every employee to contribute to strategic programs and learn through hands-on experience.

Compensation

Competitive compensation and benchmark benefits package: 100% paid healthcare premiums, 401K matching, generous PTO, fitness allowance. Staff travel all over the world to engage with members, partners, and government – a unique opportunity to gain international experience and witness the impact of Wi-Fi.

An unbeatable professional network. Employees collaborate daily with representatives from a virtual “Who’s Who” of the high-tech industry and contribute to the advancement of Wi-Fi into growing sectors including Internet of Things and healthcare.

Qualified applicants are invited to send their resume, salary history, and compensation expectations to cjones@wi-fi.org

title: Software Engineer
description:
Company Overview

Veritas' vision is to enable organizations to thrive in this new world of digital business.

Did you know that the International Data Corporation (IDC) predicts that data will double every 2 years, reaching 44 zeta bytes by 2020? That's more bytes than gallons of water in the ocean and an exponentially growing problem for businesses. Veritas helps organizations harness the power of their data & turn it into actionable insights.

We believe information is everything! Data is an organization's digital currency; a critical business asset that is growing in value. We are the only company that provides a data management platform to address the core challenge of accessing, managing, and analyzing all of their data, no matter where it is, in real time - allowing organizations to truly maximize the value of their data.

The Appliance Solutions (AS) organization is changing the backup and recovery game for customers—built on industry-leading backup software, our appliances address the technical complexities of modern data protection and optimized secondary storage for companies of all sizes. As the fastest-growing organizations within Veritas, Appliance Solutions is in the business of solving customer problems better than anyone else. Entrepreneurial in nature, get-it-done attitude, mindset to win, culture of open, transparent communication and collaboration are the core values that drive its success

Appliance Solutions Engineering is currently looking for motivated individuals who not only “do” but are also leaders who influence change and make a difference. The team is always looking for passionate, dedicated individuals who are self-motivated in their work and careers.

Responsibilities
  • Participating in Agile development activities including sprint planning, stand-ups, retrospectives and demos.
  • Responsible for design, implementation, test, automating and maintenance of software modules to a high quality standard
  • Strives daily to increase the code coverage numbers for test code
  • Able to work in various layers of the software stack
  • Participates in peer reviews
  • Ability to work on full stack development (Frontend and Backend)
  • Ability to work in a fast paced and challenging environment
  • Communicate and collaborate among cross-functional teams in a multinational environment
  • Lead or participate in a scrum team to continuously improve
Qualifications
  • 2+ years’ experience with in-depth knowledge of the required programming languages Java or GoLang
  • Excellent software engineering skills are a must, as you’ll be working with some of the best in the industry
  • Experience with OOP and multi-threaded application development (using Enterprise Java and Spring Framework is a plus)
  • Experience with Python, Perl or a scripting language
  • Experience of developing REST based web services
  • Experience in user interface development using Angular JS and HTML5
  • Experience working on AWS infrastructure
  • Experience working with databases like MongoDB, MsSQL
  • Experience developing highly secure, scalable, Internet facing solutions
  • Experience programming on Linux platform
  • Good debug/problem-solving and organizational skills
  • A fast learner and self-starter with intellectual horsepower
  • Excellent communication skills, both oral and written
  • Excellent working in a collaborative team environment
  • Ability to work without supervision
  • Experience with Agile development methodologies including unit testing, test-driven development, Continuous Integration, Continuous Testing, Pairing, Automated Testing is a plus
  • Knowledge of Networking and Storage a plus
  • Knowledge of cloud infrastructure design a plus
  • Experience with continuous software delivery model is a plus
  • Degree in Computer Science (Masters preferred) or equivalent experience required

title: Software Engineer
description:
Company Description

Turnitin is revolutionizing the experience of writing to learn. Turnitins formative feedback and originality checking services promote critical thinking, ensure academic integrity and help students improve their writing. Turnitin provides instructors with the tools to engage students in the writing process, provide personalized feedback, and assess student progress over time. Turnitin's applications are used by more than 30 million students at 15,000 institutions in 140 countries. Turnitin is headquartered in Oakland, Calif., with international offices in Newcastle, U.K., Utrecht, Netherlands, Seoul, South Korea and Melbourne, Australia.

Job Description

What youll get from us:
  • A smart, fun, and casual environment where you can learn from and teach others.
  • Flexibility in technology and development practices.
  • A great mission -- youll get to build systems that help students around the world improve their writing.
  • Freedom to not only work on a small team focused on making great products, but also to contribute cross-functionally and through the entire development lifecycle to make that happen.
  • A great location in the Strip District, upstairs from Pamelas and Smallman Galley.
What we expect from you:
  • Enthusiasm for solving challenging problems.
  • At least three years of solid experience with developing HTTP APIs, preferably using dynamic languages (we use Python).
  • Solid experience understanding relational databases and writing SQL (we use PostgreSQL).
  • Experience leading a development team through a substantial feature and carrying it through to production, working with product, design, and QA folks to make it right.
  • Practical experience writing unit tests and integration (end-to-end) API tests.
  • Ability to collaborate in an agile process with a cross-functional team on both small and large scale changes.
  • Familiarity with distributed source control platforms (we use git and GitHub).
  • Ability to communicate with both sales and support to ensure our product is being used as intended, and to help brainstorm and implement solutions when our customers run into issues.
Above and beyond:
  • Real-world experience delivering APIs with Python and PostgreSQL, especially serving data to modern single-page applications built with React or Angular.
  • Working with Docker in development and production environments.
  • Experience with a modern service architecture, including service discovery, monitoring, caching, centralized logging, reliable background job processing, and failover.

title: Software Engineer
description:
Overview of Position

Varsity Tutors operates the leading live learning platform in the United States and is building a global on-demand expert network. Students can receive live 1:1 help online, on mobile, or in-person in over 1,000 subjects facilitated by 30,000 experts. Our mission and vision are to help people learn by seamlessly connecting experts and learners in any subject, anywhere, anytime.

We're a DevOps shop where we take great pride in the quality of our code, our processes, and our services. We have a complete CI/CD software lifecycle and an evolving services-oriented-architecture hosted in AWS. We operate in a highly collaborative environment with Product and Design to build experiences that matter to our customers. At Varsity Tutors, engineers do not just write code, they actively participate in the conversation on what and how to build the systems and solutions that matter to our customers. If you love your customers as much as we do, we'd love to hear from you.

If your passion is building rock-solid services and APIs that are the heart of the user experience, and you want to work for one of the fastest growing companies in the technology space, we have a place for you!

Qualifications
  • 5+ years coding experience
  • 3+ years experience with Ruby on Rails or similar web frameworks (e.g. Django)
  • 3+ years experience with highly concurrent languages such as GoLang, Erlang or Scala
  • Experience with deployment systems (e.g. CodeShip, AWS CodeDeploy)
  • Familiarity with AWS Services (e.g. RDS, Kinesis, EC2, et cetera)
  • Familiarity with the Linux Operating System and command-line tools
  • Understanding of OO design, algorithms, and data structures
  • Aptitude to quickly learn new languages and technologies as necessary
  • Computer Science or related degree
Responsibilities
  • Write performant, maintainable code that is easy to read and well-documented
  • Write automated tests to thoroughly validate the correctness of your code
  • Deploy large-scale web applications
  • Have a focus on quality, and operate iteratively to get from good to better
  • Be a part of your team’s on-call rotation; we all own our code end-to-end from development to deployment to operations
  • Come ready to learn from some of the best and brightest in the industry
  • Work independently and collaboratively in a dynamic and fast-moving team
  • Be effective in a team environment working with fellow engineers, product management, and design

title: Software Engineer
description:
Are you fascinated by the craft of software and passionate about making the world a better place? Let’s talk.

At Brightmind you’ll help create the first digital meditation coach that creates custom guided meditations based on user interests and level of experience. The logic behind the automated coach is based on the teaching style of Shinzen Young, who is a world-renowned meditation teacher and mathematician. The team is small, collaborative, and energetic. Mindfulness is an exploding industry and this position will allow you to shape it. You’ll also have the opportunity to explore mindfulness personally with world class teachers.

What you’ll be doing
  • Validating concepts by designing and prototyping lean POCs
  • Creating and maintaining a native iOS application using Swift
  • Consulting with the team on platform capabilities that can be leveraged in product design
  • Database and applications architecture design
  • Unit-testing code for robustness, including edge cases, usability, and general reliability
  • Automated testing and CI/CD pipelines
  • Help to replicate our iOS build for Android
What you’ll bring
  • 2-3 years experience with Swift, farmiliarity with Android
  • Strong CS fundamentals and knowledge of object-oriented programming and software design patterns such as AOP, MVC, MVVM, etc.
  • Knowledge of low-level C-based libraries is a plus
  • Knack for benchmarking and optimization
  • Comfort developing, maintaining, and optimizing RESTful APIs
  • Familiarity with the AWS/AMS ecosystem
  • Can provide solid recommendations around tech stack and best practices
  • Open and excited to learn emerging technologies
About us

Brightmind is a startup at its best.

We expect everyone to act as an owner of the company and contribute ideas to our business strategy and any area of the business that interests them. The fact that our product will very clearly and directly decrease suffering and increase kindness only adds to the fervor.

We’ve intentionally created an efficient collaborative culture. We structure our meetings enough to stay on track yet not so much to diminish creativity. Everyone feels confident enough to share even their crazy ideas but are also humble enough to move on without flinching. On a day-to-day basis, we’re in charge of our own to do lists, but we also often ask each other for help when we don’t know what to do next. Decision making is shared when that makes sense and delegated when that makes sense. We embrace an interdisciplinary approach where designers, developers, marketers, and the CEO contribute to brainstorming. We have a solid network of business, technical, content, marketing, and investment advisors.

title: Software Engineer
description:
Oklahoma City,Oklahoma,United States
6J7BP2

The Boeing Defense, Space & Security (BDS) Bomber Aircraft Sustainment Programs is seeking a Software Engineer to support the Avionics Software product development activities throughout the aircraft modification lifecycle.

The Aircraft Platform Software Team is responsible for the software architecture and design modifications of the following system components:
  • Flight Management
  • Navigation
  • Test Modes, Monitoring and Reporting
  • Mission Management
  • Operator Controls and Displays
  • Sensor Management
  • Communication Systems
  • Weapon Management
Responsibilities for this position include working with an engineering team to develop software products through all phases (requirements, design, development, and integration/test).

Boeing is the world's largest aerospace company and leading manufacturer of commercial airplanes and defense, space and security systems. We are engineers and technicians. Skilled scientists and thinkers. Bold innovators and dreamers. Join us, and you can build something better for yourself, for our customers and for the world.

Basic Requirements:

This position requires the ability to obtain a US Security Clearance for which the US Government requires US Citizenship.

Preferred Skills & Experience:
  • Secret clearance
  • Rationale DOORs, Clearcase, and Clearquest
  • Experience with the software estimating process
  • Experience with export controls
  • Minimum of 2+ years working on large complex development system/activities
  • Technical leadership of complex Software Architectures
  • Experience with DO-178B assurance levels and/or Agile Software methods
  • Ada, C, C++, and C# and scripting programming languages
  • Unix and Linux Operating Systems
  • Experience with Real-Time POSIX Operating Systems (VxWorks, Integrity, etc.)
Typical Education & Experience:

Bachelor's and 2 or more years' experience or a Master's degree with experience. Bachelor, Master or Doctorate of Science degree from an accredited course of study, in engineering, computer science, mathematics, physics or chemistry. ABET is the preferred, although not required, accreditation standard.

Yes, 10 % of the Time
SSM
Individual Contributor
No

Standard
United States; The Boeing Company

title: Senior Software Engineer
description:
Imagine Learning is looking for a savvy Senior Software Engineer to help us design and implement the platform that enables cloud-based education for K-12. He/she will be able to coordinate and manage input from business and technology stakeholders across the enterprise and be responsible for the design and execution of large-scale technology initiatives.

The role is a self-organized Senior Software Engineer with solid C# .NET, .NET Core using Visual Studio and web service development experience. In this position, you are first and foremost a passionate and talented developer that can work in a dynamic environment as a member of Agile Scrum teams. Your strong technical, problem solving abilities, coding, testing and debugging skills are just a start. You must be dedicated to filling product backlog and delivering production-ready code in two-week sprints. You must be willing to go beyond the routine and be prepared to do a little bit of everything.

Qualifications
  • Bachelor’s degree in a technical field such as computer science, computer engineering or related field required
  • Typically requires 5+ years of experience in application services development for large scale systems
  • Experience with web services standards and related technologies (.NET, .NET Core, HTTP, XML, JSON, REST)
  • Experience programming in C#, Java, and also place high value on ability to be productive in wide range of environments and willingness to learn unfamiliar tools
  • Solid understanding of SQL
  • Experience with Azure and AWS Cloud platforms
  • Knowledge of database concepts, and data structures
  • Experience with Test-Driven Development and Continuous Deployment
  • Proven problem-solving skills and an ability to respond resourcefully to new demands, priorities and challenges
  • Excellent verbal, written and listening communication skills with an ability to develop relationships with key partners

title: Software Engineer
description:
Join us in building and delivering the next-generation of tools & services to developers using the Unity game engine! The Unity Austin team is responsible for the Unity build pipeline subsystems and related workflows, as well as the Unity Cloud Build service. As a Software Engineer, you will be working closely with the core engine, editor, and service teams in architecting new and improved subsystems, features, UI components, and APIs used by millions of developers around the world.

What You Will be Doing
  • Collaborate in architecting and implementing Unity engine and editor features and improvements.
  • Implementing cloud service support features in the Unity engine.
  • Participating in the design of new services, specifically as it relates to subsystems that are appropriate for engine integration.
Skills & Requirements

Candidates are expected to have experience and capability in the following areas:
  • BS in Computer Science or equivalent work experience
  • At least one year of hands-on programming experience using C++ and/or C#
  • Familiarity with web service languages and frameworks (Javascript, NodeJS, Ruby, etc.)
  • At least one year of work experience or internship with large scale software development
Things we would like to see (but are not required):
  • Experience with game engine development
  • Development experience with the Unity engine
  • Participation or interest in video game culture
  • Hobby projects that demonstrate aptitude in the core skill requirements
We would prefer candidates who are located in or willing to relocate to the Austin, Texas area, but will consider an off-site arrangement for just the right person.

Who are we?

We are product-driven, curious, and creative. We aggressively reinvest in development to keep Unity moving and evolving - from expanding usability and power, to platform reach. With over a billion installs per month, Unity touches gamers and non-gamers alike. As well as video games, our software is used in industries as diverse as medicine, visualisation and shopping - democratizing game development while solving hard problems and enabling success for a huge range of developers worldwide.

Today, Unity has expanded to over 15 international offices and has employees in 23 countries. Every person at Unity Technologies has an inherent passion and driven spirit and it isnt enough to be able to do the job- were looking for people that color outside the lines, are looking to be freed from the process tangle, and can dream big!

title: Software Engineer
description:
Software Engineer
  • Position Title: Software Engineer

Looking for an exciting career in an industry where you can make a positive impact on people’s lives? If you are a high achiever, exhilarated by a good challenge, thrive on new ideas, enthusiastic about life, get connected with ZPower!!! We are actively searching for a Software Engineer. This position will be responsible for design, development, testing and support of desktop, web, and mobile based applications.

Job Responsibilities:
  • Work closely with the Software Development Team to design, develop, test, and implement software applications
